org.gearvrf

Class GVRObjectPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRBehavior
          • org.gearvrf.GVRPicker
            • org.gearvrf.GVRObjectPicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener

    public class GVRObjectPicker
extends GVRPicker
    Finds the scene objects that intersect the scene object the picker is attached to. For a scene object to be pickable, it must have a GVRCollider component attached to it that is enabled. The picker returns an array containing all the collisions as instances of GVRPickedObject. The picked object contains the collider instance, the distance between the colliding and the scene object and the center of the scene object hit in world coordinates. The picker maintains the list of currently picked objects which can be obtained with getPicked() and continually updates it each frame. When a pickable object is inside the view frustum, the picker generates one or more pick events (IPickEvents interface) which are sent the event receiver of the scene. These events can be observed by listeners. - onEnter(GVRSceneObject) called when the scene object enters the frustum. - onExit(GVRSceneObject) called when the scene object exits the frustum. - onInside(GVRSceneObject) called while the scene object is inside the frustum. - onPick(GVRPicker) called when the set of picked objects changes. - onNoPick(GVRPicker) called once when nothing is picked.
    See Also:
    IPickEvents, GVRSceneObject.attachComponent(GVRComponent), GVRCollider, GVRComponent.setEnable(boolean), GVRPicker.GVRPickedObject, GVRPicker

    • Method Detail

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float frameTime)
        Description copied from class: GVRBehavior
        Called each frame before rendering the scene. It is not called if this behavior is not attached to a GVRSceneObject.
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Overrides:
        onDrawFrame in class GVRPicker
        Parameters:
        frameTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()

      • doPick

        public void doPick()
        Scans the scene graph to collect picked items and generates appropriate pick events. This function is called automatically by the picker if it is attached to a scene object. You can instantiate the picker and not attach it to a scene object. In this case you must manually set the pick ray and call doPick() to generate the pick events.
        Overrides:
        doPick in class GVRPicker
        See Also:
        IPickEvents, GVRFrustumPicker.pickVisible(org.gearvrf.GVRScene)

      • intersect

        protected boolean intersect(GVRSceneObject.BoundingVolume bv1,
                            GVRSceneObject.BoundingVolume bv2)
        Determines whether or not two axially aligned bounding boxes in the same coordinate space intersect.
        Parameters:
        bv1 - first bounding volume to test.
        bv2 - second bounding volume to test.
        Returns:
        true if the boxes intersect, false if not.
